overview: The GitHub Copilot VS Code January 2026 release (v1.109) focuses on agent-driven workflows: improved session management, expanded agent/model integrations (including Claude agent support in public preview), and multiple UX and security enhancements.

detailed_explanation.title: Agent extensibility (models + integrations)
bullets: Claude agent support is in public preview, enabling delegation to Anthropicâ€™s official Claude Agent SDK using Claude models from your Copilot subscription.
Richer chat interactions with MCP apps enable more tool-driven experiences in VS Code.

detailed_explanation.title: Copilot Chat and inline UX
bullets: Chat streaming responsiveness is described as faster and snappier.
Higher-quality reasoning results are highlighted for more reliable answers and task execution.
The editor inline chat experience was revamped to make in-context interactions more natural.

detailed_explanation.title: Multi-agent session management
bullets: Agent session management is improved for delegating work across Copilot, Claude, local agents, background agents, and cloud agents.
Status indicators highlight sessions needing attention and subagents can run in parallel.
The release emphasizes seamless handoff and intervention during agent work.

detailed_explanation.title: Customization and repeatable workflows
bullets: Agent orchestrations support building repeatable workflows tailored to a team or project.
Agent Skills and org-wide customization are positioned as ways to improve consistency across developers.

detailed_explanation.title: Optimizations and security controls
bullets: Copilot Memory is described as retaining relevant context across interactions.
Faster code search via external indexing is called out for large repos.
Terminal command sandboxing is described as experimental and limited to macOS/Linux only.

key_changes: Expanded agent extensibility, including Claude agent support (public preview) and richer MCP app tool interactions.
Improved Copilot Chat responsiveness and updated inline chat UX.
Enhanced multi-agent session management, customization via orchestrations/skills, and new security controls like terminal sandboxing.
impact: VS Code users relying on Copilot agents may see improved delegation, visibility, and faster iteration across multiple agent/session types.
Teams using controlled workflows can standardize tasks via orchestrations and skills.
Developers on macOS/Linux may gain additional safety via terminal sandboxing, but it is experimental.
caveats: Claude agent support is in public preview.
Terminal command sandboxing is experimental and available on macOS/Linux only.
Exact availability by plan, region, or channel for specific sub-features is Not stated in the article.
insights: The update is framed around agent capability expansion and operational ergonomics (session management, handoff, observability) rather than just suggestion quality.
Security and control language (sandboxing, auto-approval rules, lifecycle controls) suggests an emphasis on safer autonomous execution.
